verse.name: c1a
verse.lines:
Glory, glory, hallelujah!
Glory, glory, hallelujah!

verse.name: c1b
verse.lines:
Glory, glory, hallelujah!
His truth is marching on.

verse.name: c2a
verse.lines:
Glory, glory, hallelujah.
Glory, glory, hallelujah.

verse.name: c2b
verse.lines:
Glory, glory, hallelujah.
Our God is marching on.

verse.name: v1a
verse.lines:
Mine eyes have seen the glory
Of the coming of the Lord;

verse.name: v1b
verse.lines:
He is trampling out the vintage
Where the grapes of wrath are stored;

verse.name: v1c
v2a
verse.lines:
I have seen Him in the watchfires
Of a hundred circling camps;

verse.name: v2b
verse.lines:
They have builded Him an altar
In the evening dews and damps;

verse.name: v2c
v3a
verse.lines:
He has sounded forth the trumpet
That shall never sound retreat;

verse.name: v3b
verse.lines:
He is sifting out the hearts of men
Before His judgment seat;

verse.name: v3c
verse.lines:
O be swift, my soul, to answer Him!
Be jubilant, my feet!
Our God is marching on.

verse.name: v4a
verse.lines:
In the beauty of the lilies,
Christ was born across the sea,

verse.name: v4b
verse.lines:
With a glory in His bosom
That transfigures you and me;

verse.name: v4c
verse.lines:
As He died to make men holy,
Let us live to make men free,
While God is marching on.

verse.name: v5a
verse.lines:
It is flowing through the cities
And the waste will be restored;

verse.name: v5b
verse.lines:
By the leading of the Spirit
And their trusting in His Word,
His army marches on.

verse.name: v6a
verse.lines:
Arise and shine my people,
See the glory of the Lord;

verse.name: v6b
verse.lines:
As the church with signs and wonders
Marches on in one accord;

verse.name: v6c
verse.lines:
His soldiers do not falter
As for Him they wield the sword,
His army marches on.

verse.name: v7a
verse.lines:
O join this mighty army
There's a battle to be won;

verse.name: v7b
verse.lines:
Let us now put in sickle
For the harvest time has come;

verse.name: v7c
verse.lines:
Countless multitudes are waiting
Just to hear of God's own Son,
His army marches on.
